title: Oxfordshire Live: Tuesday 15 November - BBC News
summary: all the news , weather and sport from across the county on monday 14 november .
plans to charge businesses parking levy .
mod 's failure to invest in barracks criticised .

documents.title: that 's all for today
text: thanks for joining us today , we 'll be back tomorrow from 08:00 with more news , sport , weather and travel from across oxfordshire .

documents.title: oxford dad worried about daughter after new zealand earthquake
text: the father of a backpacker from oxford stranded in new zealand after the earthquake says he 's worried about how she 'll get back home .
alistair morris 's daughter bethan is in the town of kaikoura which has been badly damaged and cut off .
earlier he spoke to bbc oxford
four air force helicopters have been airlifting people out of kaikoura on the south island after battling strong winds and heavy rain earlier .
hundreds of aftershocks continue to rock the area .
two people were killed in the magnitude-7.5 earthquake .

documents.title: south weather
text: south weather

documents.title: residents could be charged for using county tips
text: taking your old toilet or shed to your local dump in oxfordshire could incur a charge as of next year .
it 's part of proposals to save the county council money , which will be voted on next week .
but it 's unlikely to see an increase in flytipping according to rodney rose , deputy leader of oxfordshire county council .

documents.title: man who raped two-year-old girl gets life in prison
text: a man who committed dozens of sexual offences , including raping a two-year-old girl , has been sentenced to life in prison with a minimum of 10 years .
daniel kilbee , 35 , of sutton courtenay , oxfordshire , carried out 30 sex crimes against six victims .
during two trials in july and august he was found guilty of sexual assault and sexual activity with a child .
he admitted 27 further crimes including rape and making indecent images of children between 1997 and 2015 .
judge ian pringle said kilbee was `` a dangerous and significant risk to the public '' .

documents.title: travel latest : headington roundabout very congested
text: for the third time in seven days the traffic lights at the headington roundabout have been out of action .
they 're back up and running now but traffic is slow around all approaches at the moment .
also in oxford city centre there is slow moving traffic along headley way from the a420 london road to cherwell drive .
there are also 10-minute delays on the a4142 on the eastern bypass from kiln lane to the a40 .
on the m40 southbound there 's the usual queuing traffic at the roadworks between junction 8 and junction 6 .
author: Al Ryan
BBC Oxford travel presenter

documents.title: long delays after roundabout lights 'flicker between amber and red '
text: drivers are facing long delays on all approaches to headington roundabout after an earlier traffic light fault .
author: Oxford Mail

documents.title: 'dramatic ' increase in chipping norton shed break-ins
text: thames valley police said it has seen a `` dramatic '' increase in shed burglaries across chipping norton .
a spokesman said many sheds and outbuildings have been damaged and thousands of pounds worth of tools have been stolen .
he said : `` police are still receiving reports with new victims coming forward regularly which suggests that the offenders are still operating and are very active in this area . ''

documents.title: woman dies after serious crash on m40
text: a woman has died after a serious crash on the m40 last week .
the driver , 53 , suffered serious spinal and head injuries on wednesday between junction 10 and 11 when her silver mercedes overturned and crashed into an embankment .
she was treated at the john radcliffe hospital in oxford but died on friday .
thames valley police has spoken to a driver of a black audi who they were trying to locate , but are appealing for other witnesses .
no arrests have been made .
it comes after oxfordshire fire and rescue had warned drivers to drive safely on the road , after two crashes in as many days .

documents.title: workplace parking levy study 'waste of money '
text: you 've been letting us know your feelings about a possible upcoming £ 100,000 study by the city council that could see businesses charged for their parking spaces .
david cameron-young says : `` workers at many companies need their cars to get to work , especially the shift workers .
bus company staff have to be there before others , to get the buses out on the roads , so that workers can get to work .
why on earth would they want to put a parking levy on such important people ? ''

undefinedjulian tomasso says : `` this will have the same effect as charging for park and ride has had in kidlington - streets blocked by oxford commuters and inane parking restrictions which deter nothing . ''
carolynne holms-sharp says : `` why charge companies twice ?
if they charged for the park and ride and not the parking more people would take advantage . ''
meanwhile andy benton asks `` who runs this council ?
laurel and hardy ? ''
kate jones describes it as a `` waste of money '' and barbara townsend adds : `` yet no money for children 's centres '' .
author: Facebook

documents.title: 'gridlock ' reported as hmp bullingdon staff protest
text: a law firm has reported severe delays at oxford magistrates ' court due to a nationwide protest today by the prison officers association , which is affecting hmp bullingdon near bicester .
gridlock at oxford mags .
hmp bullingdon refusing prisoners due to strike action .
ddj risen .
prisoner ( on recall ) back to cells .

documents.title: fire crews damping down in aftermath of chilson blaze
text: firefighters are still on the scene of yesterday 's fire in pudlicote lane , chilson , damping down and removing debris from the thatched cottage .

it was a large operation , with firefighters from charlbury , witney , hook norton , eynsham , banbury , woodstock , kidlington , bicester , bampton , burford , abingdon , oxford , goring , and stowe-on-wold stations , and support from thames valley police , south central ambulance service , the british red cross rapid relief team , oxfordshire county council emergency planning team and west oxfordshire district council .
incident commander jason crapper said : `` it is really disappointing that we were not able to do more to prevent damage to the thatch roof itself .
`` however , the firefighting crews did well to prevent fire spread to the two adjoining houses and to save a considerable number of personal possessions from the property . ''
the fire is thought to have started in a chimney .

documents.title: breakingpolice confirm two dead in house fire
text: police have stopped searching for two people who died in a fire at a cottage in the grounds of blenheim palace .
thames valley police said they are satisfied the bodies of the two elderly occupants were inside the property after wednesday 's fire .
a spokesman said a file is being prepared for the coroner and the residents ' next of kin have been informed .
he added : `` our thoughts are with the families of the two people . ''

documents.title: christmas is coming ( 2 )
text: if you 're anything like us you 'll be playing christmas tunes in the office and will have stocked up on mulled wine and christmas pud , but if not , a chilling reminder on george street that it 's just 40 days away
last night we installed oxford 's christmas lights ready for # oxlightfest16 !

documents.title: christmas is coming ( 1 )
text: if you 're anything like us you 'll have already bought all your christmas presents , but if not , a chilling reminder in the middle of broad street that it 's less than six weeks to go and counting
it 's beginning to look a lot like # christmas down oxford broad street !
thanks for the lovely tree @ twitterid # xmasinox

documents.title: supermoon over henley
text: those who were hoping to see the supermoon over henley last night were thwarted by low cloud .
author: Henley Standard

documents.title: pepperell on track to qualify for european tour
text: abingdon 's eddie pepperell remains well placed at the european tour qualifying event in catalunya .
pepperell will begin his fourth round today and is at 14th place and 5 under par overall .
the top 25 at the end of the tournament receive a 2017 tour card .
he revealed yesterday that he needed the help of the tournament physio to continue as he has sprained his ankle .
author: Robyn Cowen
Presenter, Radio Oxford Sport

documents.title: search for banbury vandal gang
text: a gang of about six teenagers smashed windows , slashed car tyres and keyed cars around banbury on saturday night .
thames valley police has heard 22 reports of criminal damage which took place between 17:00 on saturday and 06:00 on sunday .
the incidents occurred in the north of banbury in areas like woodfield , rye close , and bettina crescent .
thames valley police is appealing for information following 22 reported incidents of criminal damage to vehicles in the ruscote and hardwick areas of banbury .
police have said the gang of teenagers are about 14 years old , and two of the offenders were on bicycles .

documents.title: roundabout mannequin about 'regulating toilet ownership '
text: yesterday we showed you images of an installation on the playhatch roundabout of a mannequin with its head down a toilet .
it 's the latest jape by 'impro ' who has made his mark over the last few years with other weird and wonderful installations around the county .
we tracked down the mysterious artist in the hope he might explain what the heck it all means but we 're none the wiser .

he said : `` the only thing i can really say is that i 'm shocked by this crime and am deeply saddened that in this day and age you ca n't take a stroll on your local roundabout without being flushed down a bog .
`` i hope that the government will take this as a sign that they need to regulate toilet ownership .
at the moment any tom dick or harry can obtain one of these porcelain monstrosities and i can only ask how long it will be before another innocent victim disappears around the u-bend .
`` i would like to extend my condoleroncities to the victim 's family and would propose that we observe a two-minute toilet flush in memory of the diseased . ''

documents.title: south today reporter out and about
text: at the building of some new flood defences in northway and marston in # oxford .
# vjlife

documents.title: oxford united : martin 'confident again '
text: aaron martin believes he can put his difficult start to his oxford united career behind him and is now in a better place personally and professionally .
the centre-back admits he has had to deal with form and private issues away from football since making the switch from coventry in the summer .
martin told bbc radio oxford he has come through that difficult period and wants to show everyone at the club what he can do .
i 'm feeling confident again and i 'm raring to go and hopefully i can another chance soon .
author: Ross Heaton
BBC Oxford Sport

documents.title: workplace parking levy examined
text: workplace parking levy examined

documents.title: best small market town award derby
text: this week is the final push for oxfordshire 's towns hoping to be crowned a champion in the great british high street awards .
chipping norton and thame are battling it out to be named best small market town .
we had shaun fagan .
( from chipping norton ) and sonja francis ( from thame ) telling howard bentham why their towns are so great .
not only can they point to them on a map , but also on a wall !

documents.title: spike in criminal damage to parked cars has banbury residents angered
text: police are appealing for information after a wave of criminal damage to parked cars in banbury .
author: Banbury Guardian

documents.title: oxford united development squad game later
text: oxford united have a development squad game at reading this afternoon .
striker wes thomas and winger alex macdonald are set to be included .
author: Ross Heaton
BBC Oxford Sport

documents.title: bradley smith testing for new racing team
text: oxfordshire motogp rider bradley smith will test for his new ktm racing team for the first time in valencia later today .
smith finished ninth on sunday in his final outing for tech 3 yamaha .
author: Ross Heaton
BBC Oxford Sport

documents.title: oxford could get workplace parking levy
text: plans to charge businesses for their parking spaces in oxford in a bid to cut down on congestion have been revealed .
oxfordshire county council is set to spend £ 100,000 looking into how a workplace parking levy could be put in place in the city .
the only other city in the uk to bring in similar charges is nottingham where around £ 9m worth of charges are collected each year .
author: Bethan Phillips
Political reporter, BBC Radio Oxford

documents.title: travel update : heavy traffic in botley eastbound
text: there 's stationary traffic on the a420 eastbound in botley around the botley interchange .
author: BBC Travel

documents.title: thatched cottage fire in chilson
text: about 40 firefighters have been tackling a blaze at a thatched cottage in chilson near ascott under wychwood .

oxfordshire county council fire and rescue service responded to the chimney fire at 16:50 yesterday and sent eight fire engines , a rescue vehicle with chainsaws to cut the thatch , and an aerial ladder platform .
a spokesman said crews wearing breathing apparatus carried out `` salvage work to save items from inside the property and stop the fire from spreading to adjoining houses '' .
more on this when we get it .

documents.title: run-down mod estate threat to defence , says audit watchdog
text: the ministry of defence 's failure to invest in its barracks , depots and bases could undermine the armed forces ' readiness to fight , a report has found .
the national audit office ( nao ) said much of the mod 's property was in a `` poor and deteriorating '' state which could `` affect defence capability '' .
it said poor housing for service families was affecting morale and recruitment of personnel .
the mod has said it will invest £ 4bn in training facilities and accommodation .

the report also highlighted problems at raf brize norton , home to the air-to-air refuelling fleet , where infrastructure had to be closed down for safety reasons and a temporary fuel facility installed because of a lack of maintenance .
author: Jonathan Beale
BBC defence correspondent

documents.title: oxford university to launch first online 'mooc ' course
text: oxford university has announced its first `` massive open online course '' - or so-called mooc - in a partnership with a us online university network .
these free online courses have grown in popularity with hundreds of universities and millions of students .
but until now oxford has not offered such mooc courses .
it is going to run an economics course partnered with online platform edx , set up by harvard university and massachusetts institute of technology .
author: Sean Coughlan
BBC News, education correspondent

documents.title: weather : 'mild with light rain '
text: it 's a murky start to the day across oxfordshire .
we 've got a lot of mist and low cloud but it 's mild for this time of year .
the cloud will be thick enough for light rain and drizzle .
temperatures in any brightness peaking at 16c ( 61f ) .
author: Bee Tucker
BBC Weather

documents.title: good morning
text: good morning and welcome to bbc local live for oxfordshire on tuesday .
thanks to emily james from banbury for our main today - it 's of a very tranquil adderbury lakes .
as always you can get in touch with us on twitter , facebook and email .
